body_html:
The example I'd love to see is how to use BiRNN to compute a sequence with one element per input sequence, with an architecture like this:

      /-- F_0..t --\
X_0..t              -- fullyConnected_0..t --> Y_0..t
      \-- R_0..t --/

So to predict each element Y_i, an instance of a fully connected network FC_i is attached to F_i and R_i, with all FC sharing all weights.

So to predict each element Y_i, an instance of a fully connected network FC_i is attached to F_i and R_i, with all FC sharing all weights.
body:
The example I'd love to see is how to use BiRNN to compute a sequence with one element per input sequence, with an architecture like this:

```
      /-- F_0..t --\
X_0..t              -- fullyConnected_0..t --> Y_0..t
      \-- R_0..t --/
```

So to predict each element Y_i, an instance of a fully connected network FC_i is attached to F_i and R_i, with all FC sharing all weights.
